name: market for thermal spraying, high velocity oxyfuel, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate | thermal spraying, high velocity oxyfuel, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28338/documentation

This is a market activity. In the case of services or immobile infrastructures, markets are connecting suppliers and consumers at a global level. For specific connections at regional level, direct links between the local producing activities and the local consumers are preferred. Transport or losses are logically not relevant for this type of products.;This is the market for 'thermal spraying, high velocity oxyfuel, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of 'thermal spray, high velocity oxyfuel, tungsten carbide-cobalt, on carbon steel substrate'. The High Velocity OxyFuel (HVOF) is a thermal spray coating process which uses the product of the combustion of hydrogen and oxygen to melt and accelerate a feedstock (tungsten carbide-cobalt powder) which is deposited on the substrate (carbon steel). The product represent the coating of 1 square metre of substrate (carbon steel) with a coating thickness of 250 micrometre. The High Velocity OxyFuel process is used in key industries such as oil and gas, power, water, mining, petrochemicals, chemicals, aerospace, paper, engineering, and manufacturing. HVOF coatings can be used as a replacement for environmentally damaging Hard Chrome.

This activity starts with the service generation.

This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
